sentence: —Our Sam Sutton: Republican Blake Masters told POLITICO on Tuesday that he raised more than $550,000 for his U.S. Senate campaign in Arizona by selling non-fungible tokens depicting early cover art for a book he co-wrote with GOP megadonor and technology investor Peter Thiel.
title: Happy New Year: Here's what could go wrong in 2022

sentence: Recently, Melania Trump and Arizona Senate candidate Blake Masters (R, Ariz) announced that they, too, would be selling respective NFTs, with the former First Lady selling her limited edition piece, titled “Melania’s Vision,” for the cost of 1 Solana coin.
author: Maxwell Newman
title: 10 Key Crypto Buzzwords to Know in 2022

sentence: A slightly slicker but similarly disturbing message is evident in a recent campaign ad by Peter Thiel-backed GOP candidate for Arizona's Senate seat, Blake Masters.

title: Rick Scott's agenda underscores the love fest between the GOP and Vladimir Putin

sentence: pic.twitter.com/5HD077MMf4 — Blake Masters (@bgmasters) February 22, 2022 Don't be fooled by the faux-innocuous assertions of cultural history or the glib tokenism of mentioning Chuck Berry.
